00045 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00046  * @brief Deinitialize the CMP0 and CMP1 peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00047  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00048  * @retval None
00049  ************************************************************************************************************/
00050 void CMP_DeInit(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn)
00051 {
00052   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00053 
00054   if (HT_CMPn == NULL) // Remove the compiler warning
00055   {
00056   }
00057 
00058   RSTCUReset.Bit.CMP = 1;
00059   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00060 }
00061 
00062 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00063  * @brief Unprotect the selected comparator configuration before setting the Comparator Control Register.
00064  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00065  * @retval None
00066  ************************************************************************************************************/
00067 void CMP_UnprotectConfig(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn)
00068 {
00069   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00070   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00071 
00072   /* Set the unlock code corresponding to selected comparator                                               */
00073   HT_CMPn->CR = CMP_PROTECT_KEY;
00074 }
00075 
00076 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00077  * @brief Initialize the CMP peripheral according to the specified parameters in the CMP_InitStruct.
00078  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00079  * @param CMP_InitStruct: pointer to a CMP_InitTypeDef structure.
00080  * @retval None
00081  ************************************************************************************************************/
00082 void CMP_Init(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, CMP_InitTypeDef* CMP_InitStruct)
00083 {
00084   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00085   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00086   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_Wakeup_Set(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Wakeup));
00087   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_OutputSelection(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_OutputSelection));
00088   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_ScalerSource(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerSource));
00089   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_ScalerOutputBuf(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerOutputBuf));
00090   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_ScalerEnable(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerEnable));
00091   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_CoutSynchronized(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_CoutSync));
00092   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_OutputPol_Set(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_OutputPol));
00093   #if (LIBCFG_CMP_65x_VER)
00094   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_InputSelection(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_InputSelection));
00095   #endif
00096   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_InvInputSelection(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_InvInputSelection));
00097   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_Hysteresis_Set(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Hysteresis));
00098   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_Speed_Set(CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Speed));
00099 
00100   HT_CMPn->CR |= CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Wakeup | CMP_InitStruct->CMP_OutputSelection | CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerSource | \
00101                  CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerOutputBuf | CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerEnable | CMP_InitStruct->CMP_CoutSync | \
00102                  CMP_InitStruct->CMP_OutputPol | CMP_InitStruct->CMP_InvInputSelection | CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Hysteresis | \
00103                  CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Speed;
00104 
00105   #if (LIBCFG_CMP_65x_VER)
00106   HT_CMPn->CI = CMP_InitStruct->CMP_InputSelection;
00107   #endif
00108 }
00109 
00110 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00111  * @brief Fill each CMP_InitStruct member with its default value.
00112  * @param CMP_InitStruct: pointer to an CMP_InitTypeDef structure.
00113  * @retval None
00114  ************************************************************************************************************/
00115 void CMP_StructInit(CMP_InitTypeDef* CMP_InitStruct)
00116 {
00117   /* CMP_InitStruct members default value                                                                   */
00118   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Wakeup = CMP_WUP_DISABLE;
00119   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_OutputSelection = CMP_TRIG_NONE;
00120   #if (LIBCFG_CMP_NOSCALER_SRC)
00121   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerSource = 0;
00122   #else
00123   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerSource = CMP_SCALER_SRC_VDDA;
00124   #endif
00125   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerOutputBuf = CMP_SCALER_OBUF_DISABLE;
00126   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_ScalerEnable = CMP_SCALER_DISABLE;
00127   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_CoutSync = CMP_ASYNC_OUTPUT;
00128   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_OutputPol = CMP_NONINV_OUTPUT;
00129   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_InvInputSelection = CMP_EXTERNAL_CN_IN;
00130   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Hysteresis = CMP_NO_HYSTERESIS;
00131   CMP_InitStruct->CMP_Speed = CMP_LOW_SPEED;
00132 }
00133 
00134 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00135  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified CMP peripheral.
00136  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00137  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00138  * @retval None
00139  ************************************************************************************************************/
00140 void CMP_Cmd(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, ControlStatus NewState)
00141 {
00142   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00143   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00144   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00145 
00146   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00147   {
00148     HT_CMPn->CR |= CMP_ENABLE;
00149   }
00150   else
00151   {
00152     HT_CMPn->CR &= ~(u32)CMP_ENABLE;
00153   }
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00157  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified CMP interrupts.
00158  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00159  * @param CMP_INT_x: specify the CMP interrupt sources that is to be enabled or disabled.
00160  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00161  *     @arg CMP_INT_RE : CMP rising edge interrupt
00162  *     @arg CMP_INT_FE : CMP falling edge interrupt
00163  * @param  NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00164  * @retval None
00165  ************************************************************************************************************/
00166 void CMP_IntConfig(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, u32 CMP_INT_x, ControlStatus NewState)
00167 {
00168   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00169   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00170   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_INT(CMP_INT_x));
00171   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00172 
00173   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00174   {
00175     HT_CMPn->IER |= CMP_INT_x;
00176   }
00177   else
00178   {
00179     HT_CMPn->IER &= ~CMP_INT_x;
00180   }
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00184  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified CMP edge detection.
00185  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00186  * @param CMP_xE_Detect: specify the CMP edge detection that is to be enabled or disabled.
00187  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00188  *     @arg CMP_RE_Detect : CMP rising edge detection
00189  *     @arg CMP_FE_Detect : CMP falling edge detection
00190  * @param  NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00191  * @retval None
00192  ************************************************************************************************************/
00193 void CMP_EdgeDetectConfig(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, u32 CMP_xE_Detect, ControlStatus NewState)
00194 {
00195   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00196   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00197   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_EdgeDetect(CMP_xE_Detect));
00198   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00199 
00200   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00201   {
00202     HT_CMPn->TFR = (HT_CMPn->TFR | CMP_xE_Detect) & 0xfffffffc;
00203   }
00204   else
00205   {
00206     HT_CMPn->TFR = (HT_CMPn->TFR & (~CMP_xE_Detect)) & 0xfffffffc;
00207   }
00208 }
00209 
00210 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00211  * @brief Check whether the specified CM flag has been set.
00212  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00213  * @param CMP_FLAG_x: specify the flag to be checked.
00214  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00215  *     @arg CMP_FLAG_RE : CMP rising edge flag
00216  *     @arg CMP_FLAG_FE : CMP falling edge flag
00217  * @retval SET or RESET
00218  ************************************************************************************************************/
00219 FlagStatus CMP_GetFlagStatus(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, u32 CMP_FLAG_x)
00220 {
00221   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00222   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00223   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_FLAG(CMP_FLAG_x));
00224 
00225   if ((HT_CMPn->TFR & CMP_FLAG_x) != 0)
00226   {
00227     return SET;
00228   }
00229   else
00230   {
00231     return RESET;
00232   }
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00236  * @brief Clear flags of the specified CMP.
00237  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00238  * @param CMP_FLAG_x: specify the flag to be checked.
00239  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00240  *     @arg CMP_FLAG_RE : CMP rising edge flag
00241  *     @arg CMP_FLAG_FE : CMP falling edge flag
00242  * @retval None
00243  ************************************************************************************************************/
00244 void CMP_ClearFlag(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, u32 CMP_FLAG_x)
00245 {
00246   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00247   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00248   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_FLAG(CMP_FLAG_x));
00249 
00250   /* Clear the flags                                                                                        */
00251   HT_CMPn->TFR = (HT_CMPn->TFR & 0xfffffffc) | CMP_FLAG_x;
00252 
00253   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00254   /* DSB instruction is added in this function to ensure the write operation which is for clearing interrupt*/
00255   /* flag is actually completed before exiting ISR. It prevents the NVIC from detecting the interrupt again */
00256   /* since the write register operation may be pended in the internal write buffer of Cortex-Mx when program*/
00257   /* has exited interrupt routine. This DSB instruction may be masked if this function is called in the     */
00258   /* beginning of ISR and there are still some instructions before exiting ISR.                             */
00259   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00260   __DSB();
00261 }
00262 
00263 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00264  * @brief Get the output status of the specified CMP.
00265  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00266  * @retval SET or RESET
00267  ************************************************************************************************************/
00268 FlagStatus CMP_GetOutputStatus(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn)
00269 {
00270   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00271   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00272 
00273   if ((HT_CMPn-> CR & CMP_OUTPUT_HIGH) != 0)
00274   {
00275     return SET;
00276   }
00277   else
00278   {
00279     return RESET;
00280   }
00281 }
00282 
00283 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00284  * @brief Set the specified reference value in the data register of the scaler.
00285  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00286  * @param Scaler_Value: value to be loaded in the selected data register
00287  * @retval None
00288  ************************************************************************************************************/
00289 void CMP_SetScalerValue(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, u8 Scaler_Value)
00290 {
00291   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00292   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00293   Assert_Param(IS_SCALER_VALUE(Scaler_Value));
00294 
00295   /* Set the scaler reference value register                                                                */
00296   HT_CMPn->VALR = (u32)Scaler_Value;
00297 }
00298 
00299 #if (LIBCFG_CMP_CO)
00300 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00301  * @brief Select the synchronous source with the CMPnO signal.
00302  * @param HT_CMPn: where HT_CMPn is the selected CMP from the CMP peripherals.
00303  * @param uCOUTSEL: Comparator Sync Output Select.
00304  *   This parameter can be one of the following value:
00305  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_CMPnO      :
00306  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH0O  :
00307  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH0NO :
00308  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH1O  :
00309  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH1NO :
00310  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH2O  :
00311  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH2NO :
00312  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH3O  :
00313  *     @arg CMP_SYNCOUT_MCTM_CH3OB :
00314  * @retval None
00315  ************************************************************************************************************/
00316 void CMP_Output_SyncSource_Select(HT_CMP_TypeDef* HT_CMPn, CMP_SYNCOUT_Enum CMP_SYNCOUT_x)
00317 {
00318   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00319   Assert_Param(IS_CMP(HT_CMPn));
00320   Assert_Param(IS_CMP_SYNC_SOURCE(CMP_SYNCOUT_x));
00321 
00322   HT_CMPn->CO = (HT_CMPn->CO & 0xFFFFFFF0) | CMP_SYNCOUT_x;
00323 }
00324 #endif
